lines.text: Don't finish the windows. I don't like seeing outside any more.
Do you ever get the feeling that you were born in the wrong age?
You don't like me much, do you?
I think you are the greatest fencer that I've ever seen.
Ah. You don't like me at all.
There is no good. There is only best.

Your blade is neither in quarte nor in sixte, and your hand is in some vague no man's land around your navel, which leaves you completely vulnerable on both sides. Now, if by sheer coincidence you happen to engage the blade in one line, you will most certainly
Swordplay is like conversation. You have to learn to listen to your opponent.
Learn to probe for your opponent's weakness, uncover it, and once you have found it? Pop! strike.
Make yourself aware of your own weaknesses, as well as those of your opponents. The good ones try to cover theirs up. The great ones use theirs. Use your weakness.
